contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Iwagi'''|岩城村|Iwagi-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Ochi District, Ehime|Ochi District]], [[Ehime Prefecture|Ehime]], [[Japan]]. On October 1, 2004 Iwagi was merged with the town of [[Yuge, Ehime|Yuge]], and the villages of [[Ikina, Ehime|Ikina]] and [[Uoshima, Ehime|Uoshima]], all from [[Ochi District, Ehime|Ochi District]], to form the new town of [[Kamijima, Ehime|Kamijima]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]], although it remains the unofficial name for the island proper, as the rest of the merged municipalities are on other islands. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,214 and a [[population density|density]] of 192.35 persons per km². The total area was 11.51 km². ==External links== *[http://www.town.kamijima.ehime.jp/ Official website of Kamijima] in Japanese [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ehime Prefecture]] {{Ehime-geo-stub}}
